references: G. E. Hardy and M. V. Subbarao, Highly powerful numbers, Congress. Numer. 37 (1983), 277-307.
C. B. Lacampagne and J. L. Selfridge, Large highly powerful numbers are cubeful, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc., 91 (1984), 173-181.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..300
Index entries for sequences related to powerful numbers
formula: For n = Prod p_i^e_i, let b(n) = Prod e_i; then n is highly powerful if b(n) sets a new record.
mathematica: a = {1}; b = {1}; f[n_] := Times @@ Last /@ FactorInteger[n]; Do[If[f@ n > Max[b], And[AppendTo[b, f@ n], AppendTo[a, n]]], {n, 1000000}]; a (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 28 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) {prdex(n)=local(s,fac); s=1; fac=factor(n); for(k=1,matsize(fac)[1],s=s*fac[k,2]); return(s)} {hp(m)=local(rec); rec=0; for(n=1,m,if(prdex(n)>rec,rec=prdex(n); print1(n",")))}
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Hardy and Subbarao give an extensive table.
Corrected and extended by Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Jul 10 2003
